timeline.bodyText: This may have gotten lost in translation, but I think we should skip the null check. Accessors are "internal" APIs, so if the values they receive are null, then it's a bug. I think we decided that any public method parameter without a @Nullable annotation should be assumed not to be null except when it comes to objects received in REST requests.
timeline.author: gkillough

replies.bodyText: Sorry! I apparently read the opposite of what you said. I've removed the null checks and the associated tests.
replies.author: JakeMathews

timeline.bodyText: We can remove this check for the same reason as below.
timeline.author: gkillough

timeline.message: test-fix(exception): Removed deprecated usage of AlertDatabaseConstraintException.
